content.description:
Aspiceres, pontem auderet quia vellerevello, -ere: to tear down CoclesCocles, -itis, m.: Horatius Cocles (a Roman hero) 
et fluviumfluvium, -i, n. = flumen, -inis vinclis innaretinno, -are: to swim in CloeliaCloelia, -ae, f.: Cloelia (a Roman heroine) ruptis.
content.question: In the sentence, what does ruptis mean?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
